nodes.bodyText: Was the default CSV? Or are we changing it to CSV?
We are not changing from what it is. But, in any case changed it to JSON (which is the default).
this will logic will not short circuit right and go through all the elements.
Found that it does. changing it.
should we use the word "nested" in the message? Also, it would help to add the name of the field that has the problem?

I thought about that. But if there are multiple fields then we need to list
them all. But ultimately, if you think from user perspective we are not
suggesting them to remove the fields, the intent here is to suggest user to
use the right format for the data that they have. Suggesting to remove the
field can be conceived as limitation. So had to carefully word it.
this validation should be done in the format (DelimitedOutputFormatProvider's validate method), not in the file sink.
discussed offline, the problem is there isn't a way to pass down the name of the format field, since we want to highlight it. So we can keep it for now and open a jira to fix this in a cleaner way.
